title: Secondary – Cycle 1 – Progression of Learning - Science and Technology (2011)
subject: Mathematics, Science and Technology

document.title: Secondary – Cycle 1 – Progression of Learning - Science and Technology (2011)

3A162E1816AA47FEAC7155294B85412A.description: Using tools to display information in various formats (e.g. data tables, graphs, diagrams)

2CC0281BF7FC4937B8977659698AD709.description: Ensuring that the procedure is appropriate and safe and making the necessary adjustments

E26A19CE306E4EA5872B1608D98FE0A1.description: Taking into account the constraints involved in solving a problem or making an object (e.g. specifications, available resources, time allotted)

032ED7E79AB045E887498B1B47954DB7.description: Defines a manufacturing process sheet as a set of steps to follow to machine the parts that make up a technical object

24D091289E444364AC3BDB478DBEB337.description: Evaluates a prototype or technical object based on the environments described in the specifications (human, technical, industrial, economic, physical, environmental)

A932711940C4436C997634EA9ED3300C.description: Determines the origins of the materials present in a technical object (animal, plant, mineral, wood)

A4B37AF464EC48B48E240170AD7C4099.description: Describes the role of links and guiding controls in a technical object

7EBB0E7C488A46A1A4A6D9096172CE2C.description: Describes the role of the components of a technological system (e.g. explains the role of the parts of a lighting system)

0120FA21919943B7B7C9E55121DEB473.description: Identifies wheels, inclined planes and levers in simple technical objects (e.g. a wheelbarrow is made up of a second-class lever and a wheel)

3B1E571164C344B5834618950DC9B85C.description: Determines the acidity or alkalinity of common substances (e.g. water, lemon juice, vinegar, soft drinks, milk of magnesia, cleaners)

A501119EBB5F42A9A308D2102D89CA0D.description: Determines the observable properties of acidic, basic or neutral solutions (e.g. reaction to litmus, reactivity with metals)

5F5A28E3D26F410FB6EC6474DF12E182.description: Interprets the phase change diagram for a pure substance

B169A72CEA014EB0B873B205C044A693.description: Names the different phase changes of matter (vaporization, condensation, freezing, melting, deposition, sublimation)

8174E5FCC9D245FE9BCC934FFC62EF37.description: Explains the thermal expansion of bodies

C55E831422BE4FE9B52D68C0F3F094F1.description: Defines temperature as a measurement of the degree of agitation of particles

7E60E4B4AC4047ACBB2C21E734D5CA23.description: Describes the effect of heat on the degree of agitation of particles

E74E9E0EC7104F45B2BEE64824FB8CC9.description: Compares the volume of different substances with the same mass

23A50AAE3DA9405B9F24F27067DF17C9.description: Chooses the appropriate unit of measurement to express volume (e.g. 120 mL or 0.12 L or 120 cm )

6AF2745689CF4F83BBE2B6A9A3C55E1C.description: Compares the mass of different substances with the same volume
